Articles.Content:
I\'ve built up a spaceplane out ofmostly C7 parts. Its a large spaceplane, with a large engine, and it has all the fuel to reach Mun and slow down the descent like a normal lander. From there, its a large number of RCS thrusters to both keep the craft on course, and act as retros to prevent the whole thing smashing up.

In my last attempt, I ran out of RCS gas, and my attempts to land with the main engines failed miserably. However, I have added yet another RCS module. What I want to know is, do you think it will make it successfully? And is it the first spaceplane on the Mun if it does? [i doubt it, but it would be interesting if it was.]

EDIT - Forgot the image. >_>, fail.
Nice. [crushdream]You wont have been the first to get a spaceplane on the moon, as many others have already,[/crushdream] but it sounds like you have a good ship there =P
Weird. In the image where the spaceplane has landed, Bill and Bob are smiling, but Jeb is disturbed.
Hey, just a tip. Use alt+printscreen to capture only your current window, instead of your entire screen.
PROTIP: use f1 to just do a regular screen shot that shows up in the screenshots folder.

I like taking screenshots with print screen. Aside from it being easier, it also shows whats going on in the background. People know you aren\'t using cheat programs, and that you have other things you could be doing.

Without Trainers there\'s no point in showing how legitimately you\'re playing the game via background traffic. Unless you want to load up every part.cfg for the craft you\'re flying and put them in massive, bold letters so people can read if they\'re modified or not.

Which is silly.

I managed to return and land on kerbin as well with the narrow spaceplane fuselage. My plane is also 100% reusable, if you don\'t count the small problem where all the wings fall off on landing, because it lands at 100m/s with no fuel :/

Without Trainers there\'s no point in showing how legitimately you\'re playing the game via background traffic. Unless you want to load up every part.cfg for the craft you\'re flying and put them in massive, bold letters so people can read if they\'re modified or not.

Which is silly.

You\'re putting emphasis on the wrong point. The main reason I use print screen is because its easier.

You\'re putting emphasis on the wrong point. The main reason I use print screen is because its easier.

How is it easier? That doesn\'t really make sense.

Hey, just a tip. Use alt+printscreen to capture only your current window, instead of your entire screen.

One extra keypress, not too much more difficult =p

I rarely use F1 for casual screenshots, I mostly use ZScreen (now ZUploader, I think)

How is it easier? That doesn\'t really make sense.

-Prt Scrn

-Open image editor

-Paste

-Save

-Upload image to Internet

-Copy URL and past to KSP forum.

I don\'t feel persuaded to do it differently.

-F1

-Upload

-Paste URL

Unless you\'re getting odd screenshots from F1 you\'re just doubling the effort needed to post an image.

-F1

-Upload

-Paste URL

Unless you\'re getting odd screenshots from F1 you\'re just doubling the effort needed to post an image.

Since I don\'t take too many screenshots, it doesn\'t bother me.

And please stop derailing peoples\' threads just to argue your case for not using print screen.
Then I can\'t be bothered to read any more of your threads.

Then I can\'t be bothered to read any more of your threads.

You hadn\'t any constructive criticism anyway.
